pros: The students that really want to learn and do a good job.  The small town feel of the campus.  The desire of the university to continue to evolve.
cons: The pay scale for adjuncts is low.  Onboarding is poor.  Communication and support is minimal.  And there is a lack of STEM-of-the-future focused degrees.

pros: The students are inspiring and their energy is contagious. The Hackettstown campus is a beautiful environment to work in. Summer Fridays were a huge perk, benefits and time off were excellent.
cons: The management was terrible when I was there, however there have been big and positive changes since I left.  The management was always looking to hire from outside. Very rarely did they recognize and reward internal talent.  No bonuses.

review_title: It was an incredible University and allowed me to grow as a student and woman of science!
pros: I couldn't be more thankful for my experience at Centenary University. I was able to hold multiple positions on campus while I pursued my degree.  The science faculty were amazing and went out of their way to help me learn and thrive.  A small school is the way to go!
cons: I wish I could have been a student longer, my time at Centenary was too short!

pros: Innovative and creative place. New ideas are welcomed and explored for feasibility. The staff and faculty are wonderful and growth opportunities are available for those who are willing to work hard.
cons: The IT department is very disorganized and not centered on the user. New systems and upgrades are implemented with no planning, testing or training.

review_title: I loved and miss this job
job_title: Intranet Content Administrator in Hackettstown, NJ
pros: The people, the cafeteria, the work, cheap tuition, great benefits, flexible environment. This job was one of the best I've had. Best 8 years of my life.
cons: Occasionally choices the senior management made were troublesome but aside from that nothing.

pros: As an adjunct professor,  you can pretty.much run the course as you like as long as you cover required material.
cons: Very low salary scale even when compared to local 2 year community colleges. Also has a distinct bias against hiring older professor for tenure track positions. Also very poorly equipped for sciences with 1940s equipment and labs.

pros: Small University setting.  Great community of employees
cons: No yearly increases.  Too many changes in leadership.
